info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 30 at 3:57AM CST until November 30 at 6:30AM CST by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria, Fort Bend, Galveston and Harris.
* WHEN...Until 630 AM CST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 355 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain in a short period of time due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area...moreso on feeder roads and near construction zones. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... League City, Galveston Causeway, Galveston Island West End, Texas City, southern Friendswood, Alvin, Dickinson, La Marque, Santa Fe, Webster, Hitchcock, Manvel, Kemah, Bayou Vista, Iowa Colony, Tiki Island, Hillcrest, Bacliff, San Leon and Offatts Bayou. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
